newsitem.title: INDIA: RBI governor sees India '96/97 GDP growing 6.5 pct.
newsitem.headline: RBI governor sees India '96/97 GDP growing 6.5 pct.

text.p: India's gross domestic product will grow by around 6.5 percent in 1996/97 (April-March), Reserve Bank of India governor Chakravarty Rangarajan said on Monday.
"It (GDP) should be around 6.5 percent this year," Rangarajan told Reuters Financial Television.
He said agricultural production would grow at between 3 to 4 percent and industrial production at between 9 to 10 percent this year.
India's GDP grew by 6.2 percent in 1995/96, below the originally estimated 7.0 percent.
The RBI outlined its credit policy for the second half of 1996/97 on Saturday, and announced measures to add liquidity to the banking system to bring down interest rates.
